english_translation: Biographical entry: Al-Ashaj of Abd al-Qays (Abdullah ibn Awf al-Ashaj) - A companion known for gentleness and forbearance

chainIssues: Biographical entry without traditional hadith structure

potential_issues.impact: Classified as Daif due to lacking traditional hadith structure, though Abdullah al-Ashaj is a documented companion of the Prophet ﷺ

Topics: Companion of the Prophet ﷺ from Abd al-Qays

english_translation: Muhammad ibn Sa'd said: We had disagreement regarding his (Abdullah al-Ashaj's) name.

narrators.name: Muhammad ibn Sa'd
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Sa'd ibn Mani' al-Basri

chainIssues: This is a scholarly statement about textual disagreement, not a traditional hadith

english_translation: Muhammad ibn Umar informed us, saying: Qudamah ibn Musa narrated to me from Abd al-Aziz ibn Rummah from Urwah ibn al-Zubayr, saying: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ wrote to the people of al-Bahrain. Twenty men from them came to him, their leader was Abdullah ibn Awf al-Ashaj. From Banu Ubayd (were) three men, and from Banu Ghanam (were) three men, and from Banu Abd al-Qays (were) twelve men, among them al-Jarud, and he was a Christian.

narrators.name: Muhammad ibn Umar
reliabilityIssues: known for weak transmission in hadith sciences

narrators.name: Urwah ibn al-Zubayr
narrators.full_name: Urwah ibn al-Zubayr ibn al-Awwam al-Qurashi

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib

chainIssues: Muhammad al-Waqidi is known for weak transmission in hadith sciences
Chain uses 'an (عَنْ) from abd al-Aziz to Urwah without explicit hearing terminology

potential_issues.impact: Al-Waqidi is a historian but known for unreliable transmission practices. Scholars differ on using his reports in hadith sciences despite his historical value
The use of 'an (from) without explicit hearing terminology could indicate indirect transmission

Topics: Incident of the delegation of Abd al-Qays visiting the Prophet ﷺ
Description of delegation composition and names

english_translation: Muhammad ibn Umar informed us, saying: Abd al-Hamid ibn Ja'far narrated to me from his father, saying: When the delegation of Abd al-Qays arrived, it was said to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ: O Messenger of Allah, the delegation of Abd al-Qays (has arrived). He said: Welcome to them, they are an excellent people, Abd al-Qays. Their leader at that time was Abdullah ibn Awf al-Ashaj. They came together when they heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ was sitting in the mosque. They said: We will greet the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. So they came in their travel clothes and tied their riding animals at the door of the house of Ramlah daughter of al-Hadath. This was how delegations would do. So they greeted the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ asked them: Which one of you is Abdullah al-Ashaj? They said: He has come to you, O Messenger of Allah. Abdullah had put away his travel clothes and took out beautiful clothes and wore them. He was an ugly man. When he came, the Messenger of Allah ﷺ looked at an ugly man. Abdullah said: O Messenger of Allah, water is not drawn in the faces of men. Rather, what is needed from a man are his two smallest (parts): his tongue and his heart. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: You have two characteristics that Allah loves. Abdullah said: What are they, O Messenger of Allah? He said: Forbearance and clemency. Abdullah said: O Messenger of Allah, is this something that developed, or was I created with it? He said: Rather, you were created with it. Muhammad ibn Umar said: Others besides Abd al-Hamid ibn Ja'far mentioned in this hadith that the hospitality of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ was provided to the delegation of Abd al-Qays for ten days. Abdullah al-Ashaj used to ask the Messenger of Allah ﷺ about jurisprudence and the Quran. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ would draw him near when he sat. He used to go to Ubay ibn Ka'b who would recite (the Quran) to him. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ ordered gifts to be given to the delegation and favored Abdullah al-Ashaj over them, giving him twelve ounces and a necklace (nasha), and this was the most that the Messenger of Allah ﷺ would give to delegations.

narrators.name: Muhammad ibn Umar
reliabilityIssues: known for weak transmission in hadith sciences

english_translation: Ismail ibn Ibrahim al-Asadi informed us, saying: (I heard) from Yunus, who claimed (that) Abd al-Rahman ibn Abi Bakrah said: Al-Ashaj of Banu Asr said to me (or reported from him): The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said to me: 'You have two characteristics that Allah loves.' I said: What are they? He said: Forbearance and shame. I said: Is this something that developed or was I created with it? He said: Rather, it was from of old. I said: Praise be to Allah who created me with two characteristics that Allah loves. (End of first version). He (the narrator) also said: It reached me that the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said to al-Ashaj of Abd al-Qays: 'You have two characteristics that Allah loves.' He said: What are they, O Messenger of Allah? He said: Forbearance and shame. He said: Is this something I acquired in Islam or was I created with it? He said: Rather, you were created with it. He said: Praise be to Allah who created me with what Allah loves. (End of second version). As for Hisham ibn Muhammad ibn al-Sa'ib al-Kalbi, he reported from his father that al-Ashaj of Abd al-Qays's name was al-Mundhir ibn al-Harith ibn Amr ibn Ziyad ibn Asr ibn Awf ibn Amr ibn Awf ibn Juthimah ibn Awf ibn Bakr ibn Awf ibn Anmar ibn Amr ibn Wadiah ibn Lukayz ibn Afsá ibn Abd al-Qays ibn Afsá ibn Du'mi ibn Judilah ibn Asad ibn Rabi'ah. As for Ali ibn Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abi Sayf, he is al-Madaini, he said: His name was al-Mundhir ibn Aidh ibn al-Harith ibn al-Mundhir ibn al-Nu'man ibn Ziyad ibn Asr. He also said: Abd al-Wahhab ibn Ata' informed us from Awf from al-Hasan, saying: It reached us that the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said to Aidh ibn al-Mundhir al-Ashaj...  He also said: Muhammad ibn Bishr al-Abdi said: I asked our Shaykh al-Buhtari about the name of al-Ashaj, so he said: 'His name was al-Mundhir ibn Aidh.'

narrators.name: Abd al-Rahman ibn Abi Bakrah
narrators.full_name: Abd al-Rahman ibn Abi Bakrah al-Thaqafi

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib

chainIssues: Multiple versions and scholarly commentary integrated into single entry
Abd al-Rahman ibn Abi Bakrah is described as claiming (zaa'ama) rather than directly reporting
Contains numerous variant genealogies and naming traditions

potential_issues.impact: This entry contains at least four different versions (Abd al-Rahman's report, al-Ashaj of Abd al-Qays variant, al-Kalbi's genealogy, al-Madaini's genealogy, and others), making it more of a scholarly compilation than a single hadith chain
'Zaa'ama' (claimed/alleged) and 'balaghana' (reached us) indicate indirectness in transmission
Multiple conflicting genealogies for al-Ashaj are presented without resolution, indicating historical confusion

Topics: Incident of the Prophet ﷺ praising characteristics of al-Ashaj
Description of forbearance and shame as divinely loved qualities
Question about whether characteristics are acquired or innate
Multiple variant accounts of al-Ashaj's genealogy
Scholarly disagreement about proper naming conventions

english_translation: His name is Bishr ibn Amr ibn Hansh ibn al-Mu'alla, and he is al-Harith ibn Zayd ibn Harithah ibn Mu'awiyah ibn Tha'labah ibn Umayyah ibn Uyaynah ibn Imran ibn al-Qain ibn Qais ibn Tha'labah ibn Imran ibn al-Qain ibn Malik ibn Aus ibn Suwayd ibn Tha'labah ibn Awf ibn Uthman ibn Yazid ibn Qais ibn Ubaidah ibn al-Qain ibn Amir ibn al-Qain ibn Malik ibn Samit ibn al-Qain ibn Amir ibn Ansan ibn Abd al-Qays ibn Afsá ibn Du'mi ibn Judilah ibn Asad ibn Rabi'ah.

narrators.name: Bishr ibn Amr (al-Ashaj variant name)
narrators.full_name: Bishr ibn Amr ibn Hansh ibn al-Mu'alla (alternate genealogy of al-Ashaj)
